intro: Rutidea syringoides, commonly known as the red sandalwood, is a flowering plant native to South America. It belongs to the legume family, Fabaceae, and is characterized by its compound leaves and small, clustered flowers. The plant is known for its aromatic wood, which is highly valued in traditional crafts and medicine. Rutidea syringoides thrives in tropical and subtropical regions, often growing in dry, sandy soils. Due to overharvesting, it is considered an endangered species in many areas.
